name: College Football Stadiums Quiz / Test | NCAA Football | 10 Questions

questions.text: Autzen stadium is tucked between the Willamette River and Coburg Hills. Which team play their home games there?
questions.explanation:
Oregon.

	Autzen Stadium is in Eugene, Oregon.

questions.text: The University of Michigan play their home games in Michigan Stadium and the University of Tennessee play their home games in Neyland Stadium. Which stadium has the higher capacity?
questions.explanation:
M & Michigan.

	Michigan Stadium capacity was 109,901. Neyland Stadium capacity was 102,455.

questions.text: Which university has a stadium which has venues nearby such as: 'Golden Dome', 'The Grotto', 'The Basilica of the Sacred Heart', and the famous 'Touchdown Jesus' on its side?
questions.explanation:
Notre Dame.

	Notre Dame Stadium is located in South Bend, Indiana and has a capacity of 80,232.

questions.text: Which university play their home games in a stadium nicknamed 'The Swamp'?
questions.explanation:
Florida.

	Because of the sweltering levels of heat and humidity on the playing field at Florida Field, former Coach Steve Spurrier dubbed it, 'The Swamp'.

questions.text: Which university plays at Kyle Field, where such traditions such as: 'Silver Taps', 'The 12th Man', 'The Elephant Walk', 'Farmers Fight', and the 'Midnight Yell Practice' takes place?
questions.explanation:
Texas A and M.

	The Aggies home stadium fills to 80,650 capacity.

questions.text: Which stadium during a 1992 night game vs. Nebraska had 'ESPN' measure a crowd noise raised at 135 decibels?
questions.explanation:
Husky Stadium.

	The University of Washington play their home games in noisy Husky Stadium, which seats 75,500 fans.

questions.text: This stadium is nicknamed 'Death Valley', which is home to LSU. During a home game in 1988, an explosion of crowd noise caused an earth tremor that registered on a seismograph meter in LSU's Geology Department across campus. What is the name of the stadium?
questions.explanation:
Tiger Stadium.

	Capacity of Tiger Stadium is 91,600.

questions.text: Which university play in a stadium simply nicknamed, 'The Big House'?
questions.explanation:
Michigan.

	Michigan Stadium was built in 1927.

questions.text: Camp Randall Stadium is home to which university?
This stadium is in the heartland of America. The fans form a sea of red in the stands. Which university plays in Memorial Stadium?
questions.explanation:
Nebraska.

	Nebraska has sold out every home game since November 3, 1962.
